blockr 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Changelog

    Blocks

    new_block.Rd

    Blocks consist of a set of fields, an expression that defines what the block produces (given the result of the previous block combined with user input), plus some meta data.

    new_block(fields, expr, name = rand_names(), ..., class = character())

  data,
  column = colnames(data)[1L],
  func = c("mean", "sd"),
  ...
)

new_plot_block(
  data,
  plot_opts = list(colors = c("blue", "red"), point_size = 3, title = "Plot title", theme
    = c("theme_minimal", "theme_gray", "theme_linedraw", "theme_dark", "theme_light",
    "theme_classic", "theme_void", "theme_bw"), x_lab = "X axis label", y_lab =
    "Y axis label", errors = list(show = FALSE, ymin = character(), ymax = character()),
    lines = list(show = FALSE, group = character(), color = character())),
  ...
)

update_fields(x, session, data, ...)

# S3 method for field
is_initialized(x)

    Arguments

    fields

    A list of field, each entry inheriting from "field"

    expr

    A quoted expression (compatible with partial substitution as implemented in base::bquote() and intended for evaluation in the context of the fields)

    name

    Block name

    ...

    Any other params. TO DO

    class

    Block subclass

    x

    An object inheriting form "block"

    data

    Block input data

    columns

    Column(s) to select.

    values

    Definition of the equality filter.

    column

    Column to select.

    func

    Summarize function to apply.

    plot_opts

    List containing options for ggplot (color, ...).

    session

    Shiny session

    Contents

    Developed by Nicolas Bennett, David Granjon, Voltron Data.
